data.title: Ruby Bhogal’s funky fried chicken recipe
data.meta_description: Crispy, crunchy and juicy, Ruby’s fried chicken will have you drooling for days.
data.text:
No matter how many times I declare that I am going to start being healthier, make better food choices, be a bit more conscious of what I am fueling my body with, if anyone comes round with the hint, smell or offer of fried chicken, I am right there like a Hoover. Here’s a deliciously moist, tender, lightly spiced fried chicken recipe for you to chuck straight into a brioche bun and top with coleslaw, jalapeños, cheese and lettuce. I’m not drooling. You are...

Fried chicken

Ingredients

For the marinade (leave the chicken in it overnight)

700ml buttermilk

750g chicken fillet (sliced)

2.5tsp sea salt flakes

2tsp creole spice

1.5tsp garlic powder

1.5tsp black pepper

1.5tsp oregano

For the coating

400g plain flour

1.5tsp sea salt flakes

1.5tsp creole spice

1.25tsp black pepper

1.25tsp garlic powder

1tsp oregano

To fry

Vegetable oil, enough to shallow fry

Method

Into a large bowl, add the chicken and all the marinade ingredients and mix well. Cover and place in the fridge for as long as possible (ideally overnight, but at least 4 hours).

Into another large bowl, mix together the coating ingredients. Grab the marinated chicken fillets and roll each piece separately in the seasoned flour, shaking off all excess.

Into a large saucepan, pour in the vegetable oil and bring to a medium/high heat. Fry a few of the mini fillets at a time to ensure the temperature of the oil remains constant – do not be tempted to chuck them all in at once!

Fry on each side for a few mins, until a nice golden brown colour. Place on a rack.

Pop the rack of fried chicken into the oven at 180C for around 15-20 mins to continue to cook and crisp out.

Grab all your burger essentials, place them all into a bun and... well, you know the rest.
